name: Avoid having multiple artifacts inserting data on the same SQL table (EGL)
description: This rule searches for tables having too many ways to insert data into them. It retrieves table (EGL records) having more than X artifacts  (EGL functions) inserting data in these tables, where X is a configurable parameter.
output:
This report lists all Functions inserting data in same tables.
It provides the following information: Function full name, SQLRecord full name.
rationale: One main source of data corruption within applications comes from lack of compliance to data modification rules defined for an application. These rules are usually related to the use of specific procedures for update/insert/delete, a specific API or a data layer that is fully tested to maintain data integrity. The creation of new, different update/insert/delete procedures and functions that do not make use the existing tested code is at origin of many data corruption cases.
reference: Standard suggestions based on CAST Quality Model
remediation: Try to reduce the sources having data insertion on the same table.
alternativeName: Avoid having multiple artifacts inserting data on the same SQL table (EGL)

qualityStandards.name: Non-Stored SQL Callable Control Element with Excessive Number of Data Resource Access
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Detection of occurrences of this pattern helps decrease software resource waste by enforcing the use of dedicated stored procedures when multiple data access are needed.

Consequence
Software that does not leverage database capabilities to efficiently run data processing (such as stored procedures and functions) requires excessive computational resources

qualityStandards.name: Excessive Number of Inefficient Server-Side Data Accesses
qualityStandards.description: The software performs too many data queries without using efficient data processing functionality such as stored procedures.
